comment: She is not consistent and changes her mind on how she teaches her class when it's convenient for her.  Her syllabus does not specify how she grades and she adds things to it without warning or explanation.  The book is not as useful as the PowerPoint presentations, however; you won't receive them until after the chapter homework is completed.

She isn't a horrible teacher, but she is really slow with emails. You HAVE to do the homework before class otherwise you'll wind up being confused. Her exams were lengthy but if you did the homework and reviewed you'll be fine. Just always attend class and do the assignments then you'll get a good grade.

If you want an easy A, this is the class for you. If you need to learn statistics in depth, maybe not. She is sweet and patient, but often makes mistakes that end up confusing the class. If you read the chapters and do quizzes before class(it was apparent from the questions asked in class that a lot of students DID NOT), you'll do fine.

PLEASE! Don't take her, whoever you are. I got A in her class, but I didn't know anything about statistic. The worst professor I ever met. Will not reply to emails,doesn't know what she is teaching and no clarity, using worst application for quiz and homework - stats portal,give all the questions before the exam in the name of study guide.

She is a sweet lady who knows her stuff. You will have 2 test 2 projects and a final. All of the notes and power points are online from day one of class. If you are not willing to work then don't bother taking her but if you are here to educate yourself then take her. You will have to teach your self a bit

She posts all her lectures online from day 1. two tests which have like 6 chapters a piece. you can miss 2 classes after that you  lose 25 points in the class. Shell answer any questions you have and is fairly clear on expectations. Very sweet woman and a pretty good teacher. Either shes improved or ppl below didnt want to work for their grade..

1)She's a student herself & as she loves to point out when she doesn't know how to answer a question(which is often)she is "not a math major". 2)She does'nt go over quizzes/hw/tests, and she tries to go over one wkst, but epically fails. Quizzes are before the lecture. Be prepared to teach yourself. She's a very nice person, but a terrible teacher.

Would never take her again. You basically had to teach yourself in order to turn in homework and quizes, then she would teach the material once it was turned in. Randomly decides when homework and quizes are due. And was never really clear when explaining the chapters. A nice lady but just not ready for teaching this yet.
Had fun. Checks projects before submitting and tells you if its correct. Gives extra credit work but attendance is mandatory to pass. Final is optional.

DO NOT take this teacher!!! First of all, she is still a student herself.  She is stressed with her own classes and assigns work around her schedule.  She will assign homework 3 days before it's due and it's possible she will change the due date.  If you like having assignments due on Friday or Saturday, go ahead.  BEWARE!

Would NEVER take this teacher again. Assigns due dates for hw/quizzes randomly some from Fri/Sat/Sun for M/W class(check statsportal daily!). 1 person of 34 got an A on a project. Most of class had complaints about her teaching style. Possible to pass if you teach yourself/have taken before! Quizzes are due before you learn the chapter in class.
